thread.title: Mason Phillips, Daymion Blevins are players of the week
thread.title_full: Mason Phillips, Daymion Blevins are players of the week - PrepXtra Story

author: News Sentinel staff
title: Mason Phillips, Daymion Blevins are players of the week
text:
Mason Phillips helped Anderson County High School secure one of its most improbable wins against area rival Clinton last Friday.
The sophomore running back rushed 42 times for 285 yards and five touchdowns, including three in the fourth quarter as the Mavericks rallied from a double-digit deficit to beat the Dragons 51-47.
The effort was enough for Phillips to earn the pros’ nod as PrepXtra Offensive Player of the Week.
Rockwood senior wide receiver Austin Cooper was the offensive online winner, picking up 9,027 of 18,356 votes (49.18 votes). Phillips was second with 8,432 votes.
Cooper caught a 33-yard touchdown pass and returned an onside kick for a TD in a 23-14 win over Harriman.
Kingston senior quarterback Paul Bolden was third with 658 votes after accounting for five touchdowns, including a 2-yard run that proved to be the game-winner in a 48-42, overtime win over Greenback.
Webb freshman running back Jahlil Jefferson, who finished fourth with 239 votes, rushed for 194 yards and the only touchdowns in a 14-0 win over Grace Christian.
Morristown West junior defensive back Daymion Blevins was the defensive pros pick. He intercepted two passes, returning his first 30 yards for a touchdown in a 24-7 win over Central, and scored a 67-yard touchdown on a screen pass.
Hardin Valley’s Dom Amos was the defensive online winner, garnering 1,205 of 2,879 votes (41.85 percent). The senior linebacker broke up three passes, posted eight tackles, including two for loss, and returned a fumble 40 yards for a touchdown in a 48-6 win over Powell.
Oak Ridge junior linebacker Kyndall Clark was second with 932 votes. He totaled nine tackles, including two third-down sacks, and had a diving interception in a 44-34 win over Sevier County.
Blevins was third with 523 votes, followed by Grainger senior linebacker Cain Lopez, who received 219 votes after finishing with 16 tackles, including a sack, in a 54-18 win over Claiborne.
Another batch of nominees will be posted online at PrepXtra.com on Saturday. The pros picks will be honored during PrepXtra’s football banquet at the end of the season.
Coaches may nominate candidates on Friday night be emailing sports@knoxnews.com or by calling 865-342-6291.
